oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Thanksgiving dinner menu
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This one-page menu for Thanksgiving dinner held at Camp Jackson, S.C. The fare included cigars and cigarettes, hot chocolate and coffee, apples and oranges, bread and butter, potatoes and peas, boiled ham, roast turkey and dressing, cranberry sauce, brown gravy, and oyster soup and crackers. At upper center is a spread-winged American eagle perched on a U.S. shield. An olive branch wreath complements it. Camp Jackson was built primarily for training infantrymen in 1917.
